dataset.title: MCR LTER: Reference: Fish Taxonomy, Trophic Groups and Morphometry

abstract.para: These reference data document the maximum length, length to weight conversion parameters, trophic status, and items consumed for fish species observed in the Annual Fish Survey Time-series core data set (knb-lter-mcr.6). With knb-lter-mcr.6, these data enable the investigation of temporal trends in the biomass of taxa as well as the abundance and biomass of different trophic groups.

keywordSet.keyword: Richard B. Gump South Pacific Research Station

intellectualRights.para:
Data collected under the auspices of the MCR LTER are available to the public after primary publication, or at most two years after the completion of the study unless proprietary restrictions are warranted. Use of MCR LTER data is subject to acceptance of the following conditions:
1. The user agrees to provide valid name and contact information prior to downloading online data. This information will be used to contact the user in case of changes to the data, and may also be used by data set authors and MCR LTER project administrators to document data usage.
2. The user agrees to cite the data set author and MCR LTER in all publications in which the data are used, as per the instructions in the data documentation. If no specific instructions are provided in the data documentation, the user is requested to include the following statement: "Data sets were provided by the Moorea Coral Reef Ecosystem LTER, funded by the US National Science Foundation (OCE-0417412)."
3. The user agrees to provide one copy of any manuscript based on MCR LTER data to the data set author prior to submitting it for publication.
4. The user agrees to send two hard copies of any published manuscript based on MCR LTER data to the following address: Dr. Andrew J. Brooks Deputy Program Director, MCR LTER Marine Science Institute University of California Santa Barbara, CA 93106-6150 The user also agrees to send one electronic copy (pdf format) to the following e-mail address: brooks@msi.ucsb.edu
5. Users are prohibited from selling or redistributing any data provided by MCR LTER without explicit prior permission.
6. Users are encouraged to contact original investigators responsible for data. Where appropriate, researchers whose projects are integrally dependent on MCR LTER data are encouraged to consider collaboration and/or co-authorship with original investigators.
7. Extensive efforts are made to ensure that online data are accurate and up to date, but the authors and the MCR LTER will not take responsibility for any errors that may exist in data provided online. Furthermore, the user assumes all responsibility for errors in analysis or judgment resulting from use of the data.
8. Any violation of the terms of this agreement will result in immediate forfeiture of the data and loss of access privileges to other MCR LTER data sets.

section.title: References for taxonomy
section.para: Definitive source of taxonomic levels from family to species: Eschmeyer, W. N. (ed.) 'Catalog of Fishes' electronic version (6 May 2010). http://research.calacademy.org/ichthyology/catalog/fishcatmain.asp

Citation for taxonomic levels from phylum to family: Nelson, J.S., 'Fishes of the World', 4th Ed. John Wiley & Sons, Inc., Hoboken, New Jersey, 601 p., 2006 as well as recent rulings by the ICZN http://iczn.org/
Citation for taxonomic levels below family: Randall, J.E., 'Reef and Shore Fishes of the South Pacific', University of Hawaii Press, Honolulu, Hawaii, 707 p., 2005.

section.title: References for trophic groups and biomass from length
section.para: Karplus I, Thompson AR (2010) The partnership between gobiid fishes and burrowing alpheid shrimps. In: Patzner RA, VanTassell JL, Larson HK, Kapoor BG (eds) The biology of gobies. Science Publishers, Inc., New Hampshire
Kulbicki M., N. Guillemot M. Amand, 2005, A general approach to length-weight relationships for New Caledonian lagoon fishes, Cybium, 29: 235-252
Froese, R. and D. Pauly. Editors. 2010. FishBase. World Wide Web electronic publication. www.fishbase.org, version (07/2010).
Used to gather historic fish lengths: Bacchet, B., T. Zysman and Y. Lefevre, 2006, Guide des Poissons de Tahiti et ses Iles, Collection Nature et Environment d'Oceanie, Au Vent des Iles.

section.title: Reference Data
section.para: These data pertaining to fish taxonomy, length, biomass estimation and trophic group were compiled from the above-cited sources for reference. This compilation of data is provided as a convenience for use in conjunction with the dataset MCR LTER: Coral Reef: Long-term Population and Community Dynamics: Fishes (knb-lter-mcr.6).

section.title: Estimation of biomass from length, and length conversion
section.para: Fish biomass (body weight in g, fresh not dry weight) is estimated using the formula w = aL^b where L is the fish fork length (FL) in cm and parameters a and b depend on species. Parameters were obtained primarily from Kulbicki et al. 2005. Diver observations of fish length are collected and reported in this dataset as total length. Fork length (FL), defined as the length of a fish to its tail fin fork, is calculated from total length (TL) using the formula FL = Lb*TL. The conversion factor Lb was determined primarily using FishBase. Where the length conversion source is listed as photograph, this means Lb was estimated from a photograph of a single individual photograph from FishBase.

section.title: Quality Assurance
section.para: These data were entered into a relational database in fourth normal form with constrained domains on controlled vocabularies for taxonomy, taxonomic resolution, reference citations, methods, and trophic levels. Cross reference queries checked these data for completeness and appropriateness of entries within this reference dataset and in cross-reference to the fish survey dataset. These data for historic length are used as quality assurance to flag lengths observed in annual surveys beyond the expected range.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Taxonomic family
Taxonomic species binomial
The fish total length according to the book by Randall, Reef and Shore Fishes of the South Pacific

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: value not recorded or not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: The total length chosen from the two sources to define expected range of lengths, usually the larger of the two lengths or the largest length observed so far in Moorea.

dataTable.entityDescription: Length to weight conversion parameters for each species.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Taxonomic family
Taxonomic species binomial
Code denotes length is being used, either Fork Length or Total Length. Needed for biomass conversion.

codeDefinition.definition: Fork Length: length to the fork in the tail fin
Total Length: length to the tip of the tail fin

attribute.attributeDefinition: The reference for biomass conversion parameters for this species.

codeDefinition.definition: Froese, R. and D. Pauly. Editors. 2010. FishBase. World Wide Web electronic publication. www.fishbase.org, version (07/2010).
Kulbicki M., N. Guillemot M. Amand, 2005, A general approach to length-weight relationships for New Caledonian lagoon fishes, Cybium, 29: 235-252

attribute.attributeDefinition: Taxonomic resolution of length to weight parameters; genus means values are an average of multiple species in a genus while congener means that values are from a single species in the same genus. Family and confamily follow the same logic. Body shape means that a and b were estimated from body shape according to table IV in Kulbicki et al. 2005

codeDefinition.definition: When no formula parameters are available at Family level, parameters were determined by body shape per Kulbicki method.
Parameters were taken from another member of the same family.
Parameters were taken from another member of the same genus.
Parameters were taken from another member of the same order.
Parameters are based on a family average.
Parameters are based on a genus average.
Parameters are specific to this species.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Length to weight parameter a from the following equation: W = aL^b, where W is weight in grams and L is length in cm.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: value not recorded or not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: Length to weight parameter b from the following equation: W = aL^b, where W is weight in grams and L is length in cm.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: value not recorded or not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: Total length to fork length parameter Lb in the equation: FL = Lb*TL

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: value not recorded or not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: Source of total length to fork length parameter; photograph means that I estimated Lb from a photograph of a single individual (photographs were obtained from Fish Base), genus average and family average mean that I took an average of the other fish in the same genus or family from our species list. Lb was assumed to be 1 for some unidentified species for which I had "No Info." Also several species (mainly from the families Labridae and Scaridae) had TL to FL relationships that vary with size (i.e., large Terminal Phase individuals have slightly forked tails). For these species I set Lb = 1 which would overestimate the FL of TP individuals.

codeDefinition.definition: Parameter value taken from a species in the same genus
Parameter value is a family-wide average of species present in surveys from 2005 to 2009 for which we had information.
Species-specific parameter value obtained from FishBase
Parameter value is a genus-wide average of species present in surveys from 2005 to 2009 for which we had information.
Fish unidentified specifically enough to apply morphometric information.
Species-specific parameter value was determined from a single photograph.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: value not recorded or not available

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any notes on the length to length conversions or the length to weight conversions.

dataTable.entityDescription: Coarse and fine trophic groups for each species.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Taxonomic family
Taxonomic species binomial
A broad category of trophic group into which the species fits.

codeDefinition.definition: Feed primarily or largely on fishes
Feed primarily on zooplankton; includes all planktivores from Fine Trophic Group; also includes many omnivores which feed primarily on zooplankton but also on benthic algae
Feed primarily on algae and/or detritus; includes all Herbivore/Detritivores from Fine Trophic Group and some omnivores
Feed primarily on non-planktonic animals including corals and other benthic invertebrates, but not fishes (may feed on fishes to some extent)

attribute.attributeDefinition: A specific category of trophic group into which the species fits.

codeDefinition.definition: Feed primarily on benthic invertebrates; may also feed on fishes to some extent
Include scleractinian corals as a major part of their diet; Many of these species also feed on other benthic invertebrates and/or algae
Feed primarily on the mucous and scales of fish
Feed exclusively on algae, plant material, and/or detritus
Includes significant amounts of animal material (including benthic invertebrates and/or zooplankton but not coral) and plant/algal material in diet.
Feed primarily or largely on fishes

dataTable.entityDescription: Lists of specific items consumed for each species according to citations. Where multiple citations for a given species are available, table lists one row per citation.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Taxonomic family
Taxonomic species binomial
Code indicating the citation source of information

codeDefinition.definition: Froese, R. and D. Pauly. Editors. 2010. FishBase. World Wide Web electronic publication. www.fishbase.org, version (07/2010).
No diet information in references and/or may be generalization of broader taxonomic group.
